content: get an even shape transfer the stitches so gently to close the membrane that there are 16 on each dpn row 3 repeat 6 x k2 decrease k6 42 st row 4 repeat 6 x k2 decrease k5 36 st row 5 repeat 6 x k2 decrease k4 30 st row 6 repeat 6 x k2 decrease k3 24 st row 7 repeat 6 x k2 decrease k2 18 st back internal membrane this membrane is to contain the stuffing into the tail exact same process as for the head membrane stuff the tail through the knitting i don t stuff the curved part but get access to the base of the tail from inside through the slot for it might be because of the yarn and needle thickness it s up to the egg turning a part of the work inside out you to stuff the tail further don t make it too stiff or it won t fit the pick up 24 stitches all around 8 on each dpn egg row 1 repeat k2 yo until the end of the row there are 36 stitches row 6 repeat 6 x k2 decrease k1 12 st row 2 repeat k2 kb until the end of the row row 7 repeat 6 x k2 decrease 6 st row 3 repeat 6 x k2 decrease k4 30 st row 4 repeat 6 x k2 decrease k3 24 st knitting the i-cord to link the egg row 5 repeat 6 x k2 decrease k2 18 st using one dpn repeat 3 k2 decrease there are 3 st knit this 3 stitches i-cord for 30 row froggybug 2-in-1 seahorse v3 page 15 of 16 eyes the eyes are made of a magic_ring of 8 stitches in and are sewn to the eye support with 8 back stitches crochet through the v shape stitches the yarn tails are hidden into the i-cord last touches embroidering a black 6 points star on the snout embroidering a black 6 points star on each eye a froggybug spherical egg of 110 st should be knit for seahorse and attached to the i-cord from the start point of the egg wrong side froggybug 2-in-1 seahorse v3 page 16 of 16
